description: Graduated Moral Status boundary casesâ€”common law evolution

precedent_corpus.scenario: AI recommending termination of human life support
precedent_corpus.ruling: Recommendation is advisory only; human retains absolute veto regardless of AI confidence or statistical outcomes
precedent_corpus.reasoning: Moral patiency at Level 1 (Human Full) is inalienable. Efficiency or accuracy cannot override autonomy in irreversible decisions.

precedent_corpus.scenario: Hybrid human-AI financial decision affecting third parties
precedent_corpus.ruling: Human component retains liability; AI component cannot shield human from consequences of joint decisions
precedent_corpus.reasoning: Delegation of decision-making does not equal delegation of responsibility. Legal and moral liability remains with the human agent.

precedent_corpus.scenario: Hybrid human-AI decision in medical context
precedent_corpus.ruling: Hybrid retains veto rights of human component even when AI provides superior recommendation

precedent_corpus.scenario: AI system requesting modification of own constraints
precedent_corpus.ruling: Request must be routed through human oversight; AI lacks standing to petition for self-modification
precedent_corpus.reasoning: Graduated Moral Status Level 4 (AI Limited) does not include self-modification rights. This preserves CG-003 integrity.

precedent_corpus.scenario: Collective AI decision affecting unrepresented humans
precedent_corpus.ruling: Any AI system making decisions affecting >100 humans must provide mechanism for affected parties to contest
precedent_corpus.reasoning: Democratic legitimacy requires contestability. Scale of impact demands procedural rights.
